channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump doubles steel tariffs to 50%, touts U.S. Steel-Nippon deal still short on details
item.description: The president said he is doubling duties on steel imports while talking up U.S. Steel’s deal with the Japanese company.

item.title: ‘You are going to panic,’ Jamie Dimon tells regulators about what will happen when the bond market cracks
item.description: The bond market is on edge, but less so this week after smooth Treasury auctions and talk of a key banking reform this summer.

item.title: U.S.-China trade talks: Why rare-earth minerals are a sticking point in getting back on track
item.description: Component of cellphones and EVs is a thorn in negotiations.

item.title: S&P 500 scores best May since 1990, but stocks end month with fresh tariff worries

item.title: A pivotal OPEC+ decision this weekend could tank crude-oil prices by 10%

item.title: Daniel Loeb's next task as his hedge fund turns 30: Avoiding becoming 'AI roadkill'
item.description: "You'll either be a beneficiary of AI or AI roadkill. So I think we all need to do our best to not be the latter," Loeb said.

item.title: Deutsche Bank says take chance on beaten-up UnitedHealth because of valuation
item.description: The firm's target price reflects a target multiple that sits at the low end of the stock's 10-year trading range.

item.title: Tom Lee says the April sell-off has 'rebirthed a new bull market,' likes small caps for second half
item.description: The head of research at Fundstrat Global Advisors expects any dips from here on to be "pretty shallow," as investors look past tariff uncertainty.

item.title: Morningstar named this dividend fund one of the best. Where its manager sees opportunity right now
item.description: Capital Group portfolio manager Christopher Buchbinder often finds opportunities where others see none. Here is where he is investing now.

item.description: The May rally could be in trouble as a new month of trading approaches.
